channel.title: [SOURCE] NukeGopher
channel.description:
Well this is a simple Gopher server.. made by me.. It serves Gopher pages..
For those that dont know what Gopher is: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher (protocol)]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher (protocol)[/url]
To test it yourself: start server, and type gopher://127.0.0.1 into your browser (Mozilla required!)
Readme:
[QUOTE] ----------- NukeGopher v1 ---------------
This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.
You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA
-----------------------------------------
1. Disclaimer
The maker of this server doesnt take any responsibility about this code
NOTICE: Please, do only send emails to my address, if its really required...
-------------------------------------------
2. Version history
v1.0 = This version, first public one v0.1-0.9 = Private versions. Not given out to anyone
-------------------------------------------
2.1 Info:
This project started as a hobby project.. It became so good, that i throught it was good for releasing :)
NukeGopher's target is to create a portable, and fast Gopher information server
Currently its pretty simple, but is very fast.
-------------------------------------------
3. Syntax of data files
All Gopher page files should be in data folder. They should end with "txt" extension
3.1 Starting pages
To start pages, you must type #START_FILE SITE_NAME. SITE_NAME is selector, which is wanted
"root" is selector for index page
-------------------------------------------
3.2 Adding links & text
Text is easy to add, just write it into file.
#RAW_TEXT: Start raw mode (print text in file straight out.)
All link commands format is same, except #LINK_REMOTE
Format is: link command (tab) shown text (tab) selector
Valid link commands are:
#LINK_DIR: Link to directory text #LINK_RTEXT: Link to raw text file #LINK_BINARY: Link to binary file #LINK_SEARCH: Link to search (no features using it yet) #LINK_HTML: Link to HTML file
#LINK_REMOTE: #LINK_REMOTE (tab) shown text (tab) selector (tab) server (must be in port 70)
-------------------------------------------
3.3 Adding file links
Easiest way to point into files is to point links into Server:fileList/#path to file#
Or you can just easily define selectors for them #DATA_FILE (tab) selector (tab) file path
-------------------------------------------
3.4 Defining custom descriptions for Server:fileList folders
Add this in config.cfg: SMsg-folders_name:Message where folders_name is name of folder. If folder path was ff/ff then it would start with: SMsg-ff/ff
Also, add SDMessage messages for messages in all folders.
------------------------------------------------------------------------ [/QUOTE]
Download (Rapidshare): http://rapidshare.com/files/25795606/NukeGopher.zip.html Download (Megaupload): http://www.megaupload.com/?d=060Y944N Download (My site) http://slysoft.kwikphp.com/NukeGopher-v1.zip Download (Programmers Heaven) http://www.programmersheaven.com/download/51407/download.aspx
Made by me (Slysoft on most other places, such as Rune-Server)

item.title: [SOURCE] NukeGopher
item.dc:creator: @stmserv stmserv
item.description:
@stmserv wrote:

Well this is a simple Gopher server… made by me… It serves Gopher pages…

For those that dont know what Gopher is: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher (protocol)

To test it yourself: start server, and type gopher://127.0.0.1 into your browser (Mozilla required!)

Readme:

----------- NukeGopher v1 ---------------

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA

  1. Disclaimer

The maker of this server doesnt take any responsibility about this code

NOTICE: Please, do only send emails to my address, if its really required…

  1. Version history

v1.0 = This version, first public one
v0.1-0.9 = Private versions. Not given out to anyone

2.1 Info:

This project started as a hobby project… It became so good, that i throught it was good for releasing

NukeGopher’s target is to create a portable, and fast Gopher information server

Currently its pretty simple, but is very fast.

  1. Syntax of data files

All Gopher page files should be in data folder. They should end with “txt” extension

3.1 Starting pages

To start pages, you must type #START_FILE SITE_NAME. SITE_NAME is selector, which is wanted

“root” is selector for index page

3.2 Adding links & text

Text is easy to add, just write it into file.

#RAW_TEXT: Start raw mode (print text in file straight out.)

All link commands format is same, except #LINK_REMOTE

Format is: link command (tab) shown text (tab) selector

Valid link commands are:

#LINK_DIR: Link to directory text
#LINK_RTEXT: Link to raw text file
#LINK_BINARY: Link to binary file
#LINK_SEARCH: Link to search (no features using it yet)
#LINK_HTML: Link to HTML file

#LINK_REMOTE: #LINK_REMOTE (tab) shown text (tab) selector (tab) server (must be in port 70)

3.3 Adding file links

Easiest way to point into files is to point links into Server:fileList/#path to file#

Or you can just easily define selectors for them
#DATA_FILE (tab) selector (tab) file path

3.4 Defining custom descriptions for Server:fileList folders

Add this in config.cfg: SMsg-folders_name:Message
where folders_name is name of folder. If folder path was ff/ff then it would start with: SMsg-ff/ff

Also, add SDMessage messages for messages in all folders.

Download (Rapidshare): http://rapidshare.com/files/25795606/NukeGopher.zip.html
Download (Megaupload):
http://www.megaupload.com/?d=060Y944N

http://slysoft.kwikphp.com/NukeGopher-v1.zip

http://www.programmersheaven.com/download/51407/download.aspx

Made by me (Slysoft on most other places, such as Rune-Server)
